title: Ticket #180: MyString binary2hex(const char *)
description:
Several places in Condor need to take a bunch of binary data and represent it as hexadecimal. The code is pretty simple... 

MyString binary2hex(const char * b, size_t len) {
    MyString hex;
    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
        hex.sprintf_cat("%02x", static_cast<int>(b[i]));
    }
    return hex;
}

(A rough equivalent that returned a std::string would marginally more complex.)

  1. Add this somewhere useful, probably in condor_c++_util.
  2. Modify existing code that does it's own thing.

Code that needs to be updated (you can usually find it by grepping for '%02x')

  • condor_submit.V6/submit.cpp, SetExecutable(), lines 1588-1590 (This is currently in the V7_3-ickpt_share-branch, expect to merge into master soon.)
  • condor_io/condor_secman.cpp, SecMan::key_printf(), line 56
  • condor_startd.V6/claim.cpp, line 2108
  • condor_c++_util/network_adapter.unix.cpp, UnixNetworkAdapter::setHwAddr(), line 217
  • src/condor_io/SafeMsg.cpp, various lines (commented out)
  • src/condor_io/safe_sock.cpp, various lines (commented out)
  • condor_daemon_core.V6/daemon_core.cpp, zz2printf(), line 203 (commented out)
